Example 1:  Counting Irregular Income
Example
:  A Veteran has been paid current-law pension based on interest income of $600 per year.  The Veteran submits a claim on May 1, 2015, and reports receiving only $500 interest income during calendar year 2014.  The decreased interest is verified upon review of Federal tax information (FTI) provided by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS).
Result
:  Adjust the award from January 1, 2014, subject to
38 CFR 3.31
(that is, adjust from February 1, 2014, if the change in income causes the pension rate for January 1, 2014, to exceed the December 2013 rate).
